Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 08:12AM licorice2006 wrote: My last Taxotere was May and I actually lost my eyelashes in June. But my hair is about two inches long and the lashes came right back. I am 56 and my hair was dark with very little gray, now it is tight tight curls and salt and pepper but I'll take it as I lost my hair twice and was bald for about 8 months. I am still not back energy wise but I am taking Arimidex and my joints are just horrible. None of us will be what we were but we're here and I believe I'm better for it. Chris
Posts.Title: Ending Chemo Treatment - When will all the side affects end? ddminer ddminer

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 09:01AM licorice2006 wrote: I started Taxotere on Feb 7th and can no longer taste either. I have horrible cravings for fried eggs which I had detested. I read an article at the onc office saying KFC mashed potatoes satisfy the taste buds and don't hurt the mouth sores, which I have. I also read that you can try using plastic cutlery. I don't know but its worth the try. I don't even enjoy my water anymore. Chris
Posts.Title: I Want My Tastebuds Back Bonnielv licorice2006

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2008 09:17AM licorice2006 wrote: I started taxotere feb 7th. My next is this Thurs and I know it will all be gone by next week. I thank god i have a family that acknowledges my moods and my daughter who tells me i'm beautiful everytime she sees me. I just wish i could see what they see when i look in the mirror. I'm not a vain person but this is really getting to me. Chris

Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2008 09:39PM licorice2006 wrote: I'd like to drop in as I started Taxotere Feb 7th. My next is tomorrow . I did 4x AC and have had two surgeries now started taxotere to follow with 25 rads. I lost my hair on AC and it grew back to about 2" and has started to fall out again !! I take Decadron and it gives me flu symptoms. I noticed comments on the nuelsta, on AC I also had this and with my 3rd shot the pain was unbearable. My Onc changed me to nuepogen shots. 1x 5 and i got them in my tummy. Bone pain was soooo much less and it hurt less in the tummy. Taxotere also can cause nail loss and Onc has me applying tea tree oil to finger and toenails everyday. Maybe I should have spread this out over several days but i am excited to find others going thru this the same time as me. Thanks , chris

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2008 06:16AM licorice2006 wrote: Good morning everyone, I'm so excited that my daughter is coming home for the day to see my new hair and "boob". Artsee- I had horrible constipation on AC and took Collace daily during chemo week.  Now on Taxotere and should have the opposite but not my luck. I'm going back on the collace. Laura- I did 4X AC this past fall to save nipple. I had 2 surgeries and am now on Taxotere 4X then 25 rads. Kissta- I may not have nausea this time but i too am not myself for 7 days. I feel like a truck hit me. Marianne- I wish i had the nerve to give myself shots. I had my children natural childbirth but show me a needle.....the nurses said they could show my other half how to give me the shots but i said "no, he'd enjoy it to much" (joking). Grannie- I keep a second pillow next to my bed and switch during the nite. The coolness helps me. It does help to shave your head as i did the first time i lost my hair. The beach was wonderful. Sunny and warm. Alot of tourists were actually in the water. Brrrr. I picked the right day and time. The dolphins were everywhere playing and jumping. Brought peace to my soul. I hope everyone can vision it and feel what i did. Chris

Aurora- (i love your name) i also itch and i'm a little nervous because my fingernails are sore. I keep looking for infection. Bridget-I hope you are feeling better. Weather was beautiful yesterday so hubby took me out for a ride. Stopped at flea market for half hour and decided to go for chinese food. Well, i still have heartburn but it was worth it. To everyone else, have a good day. Chris

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 08:43AM licorice2006 wrote: Goodmorning everyone, I woke up this morning and i no longer have that metal/salt taste in my mouth. 14 days. Donnalee- I'm glad you have your daughter with you today. I hope she brought a jacket with her. I went back to Ma last june and i needed a jacket at nite. Aurora- I hope those hives go away. The first time i took decadron, I had the hives but Benadryl took care of it. We were out shopping and i had to scratch scratch scratch my butt cheeks. Needless to say we had to leave the mall. Kim- I  crashed and had a crying spell at the onc office last week. I allowed myself the tears, not trying to figure why, but that i felt a whole lot better after. Venusia- Today is day 14 after chemo and the metal/salt taste is gone. For me, this is the worst se. I made shrimp scampi last week and when my other half took a bite he spit it out. Most of the food i now cook is bland and i serve it with the pepper mill. beegirl- Have you asked for something to help you sleep? My GP gave me samples of Lunesta and ambien for the nights i'm on decadron. I also have RLS and my meds don't work while getting neupogen so the sleep pills help. Hugs to everyone, Chris
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2008 09:25AM licorice2006 wrote: Artsee-I was told that day 10 is the lowest and i should avoid people and germs. They rescheduled my chemo because i was going to the daytona 500 and would be in a crowd. I've been thru this before and am not as paranoid as the first time but i'm still careful around people. Rachel- My eyebrows were also thick and dark. They have thinned out but i haven't lost them or my eyelashes. I use an eyebrow stick to give them some color. I never used makeup as i do now but it makes ME feel better. Back in Aug. , when i got my first wig , i was given a gel filled (sorry, chemo brain ) it's about 16" long and 1" wide. It's filled with gel so you can put in refridge to cool. It has velcro( that took me 3 min to think of the word) you wrap it around your head and it helps keep you cool and holds the wig in place. Nolana-There is a woman that gets chemo the same time i do and she lost her eyelashes. She lined her eyelid with dark pencil and it really made a difference. Hope everyone has a good day Chris

Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2008 02:51PM licorice2006 wrote: This is cool-- Cut the teeshirt under the armpit all the way across. Lean forward (the instructor leaned back but at my age!) and put head thru the shirt keeping the hemmed end at your nape and over your ears. Take the hanging material and turn over and over to make a rope. Twist  the entire "rope" once making a loop and place it around your head. I then move the front to the back because i did it backwards. You can play with the rope , add a pin or a flower. If anyone tries this, I hope my directions are good and not frustrating. I followed my directions three times and got it . Chris

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2008 04:34AM licorice2006 wrote: Well it's now 4:06 and i'm still awake. I just said the hey with it and put the coffee on and my paper will be here any time. Enjoyed the kids and they loved the baskets i put together. Grannie i hope the makeup class is like the look good feel good class i went to. They gave you alot of stuff, it may not be colors you like but they match your skin tone. Pam, I had them switch my chemo and hydration from thurs and fri to mon and tues. And if i need more hydration i can get right in.Also i was feeling lousy on the weekends and my husband has weekends off. Tomorrow is going to be rough with no sleep. I have OV at 9:00 and then 3rd chemo right after. I  keep telling myself that after morrow only 1 more to go. Yeh.....It's been a long 9 months to date. My onc said i'll have about 3 weeks before i start 25 rads. I just want my hair and taste back. I've also got to find out when to set up apt with recon surgeon. I plan on listening to him and then research the options. Di53- I'll be the night owl this Sun when I start the decadron. I hope your finally getting some sleep. Nolana-Did you enjoy the LGFB class? I have a good one for everyone- before starting AC last year, my onc scheduled me for a PET . My ins co paid for the injection and not the PET. Well, they then paid for the PET and took back payment for injection. I have had so many people involved in trying to resolve this. I now have to appeal this before 180 days. I'm talking about $1200. The office manager at onc told me to bring in appeal form and she will fill it out since she has more experience with ins companies. It never ends. I hope everyone has a good day, Chris
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2008 01:04AM licorice2006 wrote: well it's my turn to be awake all night. With the day i had i thought i'd sleep no problem. We started by draining the pool two inches so mr vaccum would speed up and drain faster.Trimmed the palms and trees behind the waterfall. Then we cleaned the solar blanket (30ft x 19ft). Went to the condo with contractor buddy for his advice on what we want to do there.Bummed us out on one major idea but i came up with another that he said was ok. Went and ordered the kitchen cabinets with the new measurements. Looked at appliances and then decided to buy all new for our house and take ours to the condo as they aren't really old, 5yrs. I picked out paint colors for some rooms but i have a question, what color do i paint a bedroom . I heard some colors are supposed to be soothing. I was gonna go ecru. Everything in fl is white, white, white. Have any of you craved milk? I drink it all day. Mostly on the decadron but it must be three weeks of craving it. Aurora- My bp is usually 112/58 but on the decadron i can go up to 173/90. Goodluck on your taxes. My cpa had me keep mileage, receipts (bra tank top for chemo) and all medical payouts,insurance premiums for the year and medicines and wigs. Rose- I asked my boss what hours were available to come back to. He said what ever i want i have. I took m-f from 9-2. Good hours!!
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: May 28, 2008 09:12AM licorice2006 wrote: Just checking in on everyone. I'm in my second week of rads and look forward to alot of you joining that site. It is soooo great to be done with chemo and that nasty neupogen. My hair is just now starting to grow but my brain is still out in left field. It's great to read as each one of you say your done with the chemo. Chris
